longDef.en: the ability to form pictures in the mind

examples.en: My younger son has a very vivid (= active) imagination.
examples.cn: 我的小儿子想象力很丰富。

examples.en: I can never make up stories - I have absolutely no imagination.
examples.cn: 我从来都不会编故事——我根本没什么想象力。

examples.en: For some reason the story captured/caught the imagination of the public (= made them very interested).
examples.cn: 由于某种原因，这件事引起了公众的关注。

examples.en: It couldn't by any stretch of the imagination be described as a (= it is certainly not a) beautiful city.
examples.cn: 这座城市再怎么说也称不上漂亮。

examples.en: There's a sex scene in the film which apparently leaves nothing to the imagination (= shows sexual parts of the body very clearly).
examples.cn: 这部电影中有一个十分露骨的性爱场面，没有留下任何想象的余地。

longDef.en: something that you think exists or is true, although in fact it is not real or true

examples.en: Was she paying him a lot of attention or was it just my imagination?
examples.cn: 她是特别注意他呢，还是这一切只是我的臆想？

examples.en: Is it my imagination or is David behaving strangely at the moment?
examples.cn: 是我的错觉呢，还是戴维现在真的是行为古怪？

longDef.en: the ability to think of new ideas

examples.en: It's a job that needs someone with a bit of imagination.
examples.cn: 做这项工作需要有一点儿创造力。
